title: Dogs Deserve Better Treatment
body:
Pet ownership comes with responsibility (“I’m Disciplining My Dog, Not Torturing Her” by Mark Naida, op-ed, Aug. 3). Training a dog, like raising a child, requires commitment. This is not for everyone—and apparently not for Mr. Naida. With a good trainer, a dog can be trained and housebroken in a timely manner. The habit of “pulling on the leash” usually can be cured in a day or two in a humane manner that does not involve the infliction of pain. If a human is unwilling to invest the time and money into working with and training a dog, then perhaps pet ownership is not for that human.
Johnny Lieberman
President, Colorado Canine Advocates
Colorado Springs, Colo.
